meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imitative.
meanings.sent1: Her imitativeness in mimicking accents always made her friends laugh.
meanings.sent2: His imitativeness of famous actors helped him become a talented impressionist.
meanings.sent3: The imitativeness of the parrot was so accurate that it fooled everyone into thinking it was a person.
meanings.sent4: The imitativeness of the mirror made it seem like there were multiple rooms in the house.
meanings.sent5: The child's imitativeness of his favorite superhero was adorable to watch.

meanings.definition: The tendency to imitate or copy others.
meanings.sent1: The imitativeness of the students in copying each other's homework was frowned upon by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her imitativeness of the latest fashion trends made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The imitativeness of the toddler in mimicking her mother's actions was both endearing and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The imitativeness of the waves crashing against the shore was calming to watch.
meanings.sent5: The imitativeness of the artist in replicating famous paintings was evident in his gallery.
